title: Thermal equilibrium - blocks in thermal contact

content.question: Two blocks, <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>X</mtext></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>Y</mtext></mstyle></math>, are at the same temperature when they are put into thermal contact, as shown. Block <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>X</mtext></mstyle></math> has mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>m</mi></mstyle></math> and volume <math alttext="V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>V</mi></mstyle></math>. Block <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>Y</mtext></mstyle></math> has mass <math alttext="m over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mstyle></math> and a volume of <math alttext="2 V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><mi>V</mi></mstyle></math>. Which of the following correctly describes the net transfer of energy between the two blocks at the instant they are first brought into thermal contact?

choices.label: Energy transfers from Block <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>X</mtext></mstyle></math> to Block <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>Y</mtext></mstyle></math>.

Energy transfers from Block <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>Y</mtext></mstyle></math> to Block <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>X</mtext></mstyle></math>.
There is no net energy transfer between the two blocks.
Nothing can be determined about the direction of energy transfer without knowing the exact temperature of the blocks.

content.answer: There is no net energy transfer between the two blocks.
